infodynamics.networkinference.interregional

Class InterregionalChannelMeasure

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.networkinference.interregional.InterregionalChannelMeasure
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    InterregionalMutualInfo, InterregionalTransferEntropy

    public abstract class InterregionalChannelMeasure
extends java.lang.Object

    Compute a significance score for an inter-regional channel measure between two sets, based on looking at the channel measure between elements taken jointVars1 and jointVars2 at a time.

    Usage:

    1. newInstance()
    2. initialise
    3. setObservations
    4. computeMean, or computeSignificance, or computeLocals

    Author:
    Joseph Lizier, joseph.lizier at gmail.com

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  InterregionalChannelMeasure.ChannelMeasurementDistribution
      Data structure to store a distribution of channel measurements.
      class  InterregionalChannelMeasure.LocalChannelMeasurementDistribution
      Data structure to store the means and standard deviations of local values of the channel measurement in time.

      • generateReorderings

        public int[][] generateReorderings(int reorderingsForSignificance)
                            throws java.lang.Exception

        Generate reorderingsForSignificance reorderings for the observations supplied here. Supplied where a user wants to generate the reordering once, and thereafter supply to a number of InterregionalChannelMeasure objects.

        Parameters:
        reorderingsForSignificance -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeSignificance

        public MeasurementDistributionPermutationsOverSubsets computeSignificance(int reorderingsForSignificance)
                                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the significance of the average of the channel measure across all subsets, by comparing it to the population of averages that could be obtained where the first region is reordered against the second. Each average in the population of reordering is made with each underlying subset reordered the same way.
        Parameters:
        reorderingsForSignificance - the number of reorderings to consider
        Returns:
        the distribution of SxP surrogate measurements for each subset S and permutation P
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeSignificance

        public MeasurementDistributionPermutationsOverSubsets computeSignificance(int[][] reorderings)
                                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the significance of the average of the channel measure across all subsets, by comparing it to the population of averages that could be obtained where the first region is reordered against the second. Each average in the population of reordering is made with each underlying subset reordered the same way.
        Parameters:
        reorderings - the reorderings to consider
        Returns:
        the distribution of SxP surrogate measurements for each subset S and permutation P
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeLocals

        public InterregionalChannelMeasure.LocalChannelMeasurementDistribution computeLocals()
                                                                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the average local transfer entropy values (local in time, averaged across all subsets) from the source region to the destination.
        Returns:
        object containing means and std deviations of local values in time.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeLocals

        public InterregionalChannelMeasure.LocalChannelMeasurementDistribution computeLocals(double cutoff,
                                                                            boolean cutoffIsSignificance)
                                                                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the average local transfer entropy values (local in time, averaged across all subsets) from the source region to the destination.
        Parameters:
        cutoff - level at which to count an individual channel as significant for the return distribution. If < 0 don't look at the significance of individual channels. If >= 0 one of the computeSignificance methods should have already been called.
        cutoffIsSignificance - whether the cutoff is the cutoff significance of the TE value or on the cutoff z score
        Returns:
        object containing means and std deviations of local values in time.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeNumObservationsToReorder

        protected abstract int computeNumObservationsToReorder()
                                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the number of observations that need to be reordered in a significance computation, based on how the validities have been supplied here, and what type of calculator we are used (this is why it is left abstract).

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
